source: Book of Proverbs (Biblical, Solomon and others)

core_concepts.definition: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the Lord; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Better is the poor who walks in integrity than one who is crooked in speech and is a fool.
The hand of the diligent will rule, while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
Unequal weights and measures are an abomination to the Lord.

learning_principles: Wisdom begins with humility and reverence for truth.
Integrity is worth more than wealth.
Hard work and persistence lead to influence.
Justice requires fairness in all dealings.
